content:
Ah, I tried following the instructions from that link, but according to Gmail Help, IMAP is automatically enabled as of January 2025.

A Google Workspace Updates blog post says that Gmail accounts in Thunderbird need to be configured to use IMAP with OAuth, but even when I try to check that by adding the @berkeley address with manual configuration, it still isn't working.

I'll try contacting Berkeley's IT support for further help.

Thank you for your reply, though, David!
creator: spanobo

content: I tried a sample xxx@berkeley.edu setup and it automatically used oauth2. My suggestion: - click settings>privacy&security to ensure cookies are accepted - start over on the setup and enter ONLY your name and your email address. DO NOT enter password. wait for google prompt,

content: David, Sorry I wasn't more clear. I used to go to my "Drafts" folder to finish any msg I hadn't completed. This time it wasn't there and when I searched for it, I couldn't work with it - Shift + Windows key + T - didn't work as expected so couldn't copy it properly. I did find it in Gmail and could copy it and send it in TB. Still not in "Sent" folder in TB but in Gmail "sent" folder. Why? Things that I'm used to are not happening as they did before. I apologize if all this is above your pay grade. Any help at this point would be helpful. I am throwing up my hands at this point. I've been using Windows a few years but this logic is beyond me! content: If this is an IMAP account, rightclick on account name in folder pane and click 'subscribe' - it may be that the folders aren't subscribed.

DrDOS said
This is an IMAP acct (tried POP) - good news. Msg finally showed up in "Sent". Did I not wait long enough? Shouldn't I have 1 in Drafts & Sent?

creator: Agentvirtuel

content:
Note : somes external applications can be a source of updates (e.g.) antivirus computer protection security software. Example. https://forums.mozfr.org/viewtopic.php?t=151864 https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/discussions/where-have-the-top-right-icons-gone/m-p/110616/highlight/true#M42771

Somes external applications, can be a source of updates, is it your case.
creator: Agentvirtuel

content:
Agent virtuel said
Note : somes external applications can be a source of updates (e.g.) antivirus computer protection security software.

Good point as I have seen over the years of threads where people use some application that helps keep their various applications updated cause issues. For example the app may think the current Firefox ESR channel version was not current and would try to update it to current Firefox version on Release channel.
creator: James

content:
I do NOT use any app or program that "checks to see if any of my programs are in need of 'updating', let alone would allow them to update any that need it." If a program needs updating, I always use that program's updating feature to do the updating.

Also, why is it that ONLY TB is behaving like this?
creator: lajoes
